comments:
Sometime during debugging the "javaw.exe" terminates with a Windows segment 
fault crash.

I've seen this in various situations. The simplest one is just setting a 
breakpoint others are hot code replacements. When you've changed something in 
the debugger and switch back to the running sessions, it is terminated and the 
Windows error dump dialog box appears.

JVM 1.4.1_01 Eclipse I20021119. I will attach the log file from the Eclipse

Created an attachment (id=2662)
log file

log file with exceptions occured during debugging

Do you have a reliable reproduceable test case that will crash the VM? Is so, 
please include it with explicit steps. We have seen VM crashes here and there 
(but nothing reliably reproduceable), and thus have not been able to determine 
that the debugger is doing anything wrong. These things appears to be VM bugs. 
However, if you have a good test case, please let us know.

If I find one I will post it. But you are right, there is a possibility that 
these are VM bugs but I'm wondering because I didn't get so much crashes with 
2.0 an Sun JVM 1.4-beta. So the bugs in 1.4.1_01 must be more?!?

We've all seen this, but without a reproducible test case that points to the
debugger, it's not fair to blame us for this VM instability.

Resolving as WONTFIX because the problem is believed to be on the VM side.

Does the time of the log entries match up exactly with the time of the crash. 
These entries in the log are simply handled exceptions that were handled & 
logged - they do not indicate a crash.

Sorry, it seems that the crash wasn't the cause for the log. But at the moment I
can't debug. Everytime eclipse stops at the first breakpoint, the vm crashes
with an access violation at adress x6d478b47.

I found the cause for the crash while debugging:
First of all the vm doesn't crash because eclipse stops at a breakpoint but it
does crash because of a separate thread.

Our application uses a parallel thread for updating a cache of some
configurations. If I disable the start of this thread the vm doesn't crash.
After  executing 3 succesfull "Class.forName" statements, the vm crashes at the
4th "Class.forName" statement.

In the normal "Run"-Modus it works without any problem.

I hope this may help you to find this annoying bug.

With the eclipse M4 build and the Sun VM 1.3.1_06. With the 1.3.1_03 I had the
same behavior yesterday.

Please attach the core dump (if there is one). As well, does the same problem 
exist on a 1.4.1 VM?

Sorry, I tried to upload the Dr. Watson dump and the log file, but the upload
was refused by the eclipse-server because the zip file has a size of about 8 MB.

I don't know if the same problem exists with jdk 1.4.x because we use only 1.3.1_xx.
